*“Nothing inevitable links the concavity of my nose with the convexity of my forehead. And yet your hand is no longer
free to stray about on the wall; now ‘you will’ something and impose upon your drawing this law from without: that it
must reproduce a given form.” *-Valéry
suggested_query: 1.2 The hand, once an extension of the mind, has become a mere tool, bound to the whims of the eye. In this way, the drawing is no longer an expression of the inner, but rather a reflection of the outer world. The form, once a discovery, has become a predetermined shape, waiting to be filled in.
suggest_context: 1.1 CHALLENGE Nothing inevitable links the concavity of my nose with the convexity of my forehead. And yet your hand is no longer free to stray about on the wall; now you will something and impose upon your drawing this law from without: that it must reproduce a given form.
